greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: sigma_3(n): sum of cubes of divisors of n.
comment: If the canonical factorization of n into prime powers is the product of p^e(p) then sigma_k(n) = Product_p ((p^((e(p)+1)*k))-1)/(p^k-1).

Sum_{d|n} 1/d^k is equal to sigma_k(n)/n^k. So sequences A017665-A017712 also give the numerators and denominators of sigma_k(n)/n^k for k = 1..24. The power sums sigma_k(n) are in sequences A000203 (k=1), A001157-A001160 (k=2,3,4,5), A013954-A013972 for k = 6..24. - Ahmed Fares (ahmedfares(AT)my-deja.com), Apr 05 2001

Also the eigenvalues of the Hecke operator T_n for the entire modular normalized Eisenstein form E_4(z) (see A004009): T_n E_4 = a(n) E_4, n >= 1. For the Hecke operator T_n and eigenforms see, e.g., the Koecher-Krieg reference, p. 207, eq. (5) and p. 211, section 4, or the Apostol reference p. 120, eq. (13) and pp. 129 - 133. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 28 2016
reference: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math.Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972, p. 827.

Max Koecher and Aloys Krieg, Elliptische Funktionen und Modulformen, 2. Auflage, Springer, 2007, pp. 207, 211.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
Zagier, Don. "Elliptic modular forms and their applications." The 1-2-3 of modular forms. Springer Berlin Heidelberg, 2008. 1-103. See p. 17, G_4(z).

M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].

D. B. Lahiri, Some arithmetical identities for Ramanujan's and divisor functions, Bulletin of the Australian Mathematical Society, Volume 1, Issue 3 December 1969, pp. 307-314. See Theorem 2 p. 308.
Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Divisor Function.
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = (p^(3e+3)-1)/(p^3-1). - _David W. Wilson_, Aug 01 2001
Dirichlet g.f. zeta(s)*zeta(s-3). - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 04 2011
a(n) = Sum{d|n} tau_{-2}^d*J_3(n/d), where tau_{-2} is A007427 and J_3 is A059376. - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Jan 19 2013
a(n) = A004009(n)/240. - _Artur Jasinski_, Sep 06 2016. See, e.g., Hardy, p. 166, (10.5.6), with Q = E_4, and with present offset 0. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 31 2017
8*a(n) = sum of cubes of even divisors of 2*n. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 07 2017

Faster converging g.f.: Sum_{n >= 1} q^(n^2)*( n^3 + ((n + 1)^3 - 3*n^3)*q^n + (4 - 6*n^2)*q^(2*n) + (3*n^3 - (n - 1)^3)*q^(3*n) - n^3*q^(4*n) )/(1 - q^n)^4 - apply the operator x*d/dx three times to equation 5 in Arndt and then set x = 1. - _Peter Bala_, Jan 21 2021
mathematica: Table[DivisorSigma[3,n],{n,100}] (* corrected by _T. D. Noe_, Mar 22 2009 *)
program: (Sage) [sigma(n, 3) for n in range(1, 40)]  # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 04 2009
(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, sumdiv(n, d, d^3))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 07 2017 */
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 43)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Jan 09 2021
